title: How does approach and methodology differ? - Quora

response.answer_text: thank you for asking. approach you check out the situation and take action according to what you feel after you could analyse, observe, discover, hear and all that stuff. methodology is when you have a method to approach a project or a problem, it means you have like a standard procedure point 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, 2.2 etc being a project manager i can make a parrallel between a project that is made by israelis and americans or germans. israeli, everything is in we don t need the manual and at the end everything gonna be working. american, everything is in also, we follow the manual and care about the very last nut and/or pin. both work very well, guess who is approach and who is methodology and wonder what are the real differences, profits/losses.

Approach you check out the situation and take action according to what you feel after you could analyze, observe, discover, hear and all that stuff. Methodology is the justification for using a particular research method.

There is no universal definition but as I understand it, a methodology is a comprehensive and coherent set of methods, techniques and tools that help you to realice a series of tasks in order to achieve an objective, i.e., tells you HOW to do something, while an approach is a more general term on how to do things and is about solving the problem using a specific point of view. For example, you may have an agile approach to develop software and under that umbrella, you have a method like Scrum that details taks and roles, but you also may have an approach on how to prioritize the backlog whithin the Scrum method. Hope it helps.

Methodology is the justification for using a particular research method. An approach is the overall style or idea that one adopts to commercializing idea services overcome a face given situation. The word methodology is more specific in that if specifies all the components required to replicate the study.

Interesting question. Let me tell you the difference with an example. In software development, we have CMMi which is a methodology which tells you exactly what needs to be done and by whom and at what time. This is quite rigid and often documented somewhere clearly so that people can exactly follow that. However Scrum is an approach to a software development. It provides you a framework which gives you the freedom to follow it as per your situation.

Methodology is the justification for using a particular research method. An Approach is the overall style or idea that one adopts to commercializing idea services overcome a face a given situation. The word methodology is more specific in that it specifies all the components required to replicate the study.

Approach refers to the planning of the steps to be undertaken for any particular project or work. Methodology refers to the implemention of the planned ideas , in the best possible and effective manner. The method to be followed, for the successful completion of the assigned work, is considered here.

As I understand it, a methodology is a comprehensive and coherent set of methods, techniques, and tools that help you to realize a series of tasks in order to achieve an objective, i.e., tells you HOW to do something, while an approach is a more general term on how to do things, it is not strictly defined. For example, you can follow a specific project management methodology, but you can have your own team management approach.
In common in common English usage these words are roughly synonymous. The word methodology is more specific in that it specifies all the components required to replicate the study.
